#summary OVAL Domain Model, version 1.0.
#labels Phase-Implementation

= <font color="#0044CC">Introduction</font> =

T.B.D.

This document describes the OVAL Domain Model
in Java language.
Most of Java classes are directly derived from 
OVAL schema definition.


|| *OVAL Schema*   || *XML Namespace* || *Java Package* ||
||-               ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model ||
||Core Common     ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.common ||
||Core Definition ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.definitions ||
||Core Directives ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.directives ||
||Core Results ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.results ||
||Core System Characteristics ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.sc ||
||Core Variable ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.variables ||
||Independent Definition<br>Independent System Characteristics ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.independent ||
||Linux Definition<br>Linux System Characteristics ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.linux ||
||Unix Definition<br>Unix System Characteristics ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.unix ||
||Windows Definition<br>Windows System Characteristics ||- ||jp.go.aist.six.oval.model.windows ||

= <font color="#0044CC">Base Package</font> =

The classes in this package are 
not inherent in the OVAL schema,
but are abstracted from the main part of it.
Figure 1 shows the abstracted classes in our modelling.

  <b>Figure 1</b>: Base Abstract Classes
[http://staff.aist.go.jp/nakamura-akihito/six/oval/six-oval-1_0/oval.model_abstract.png]


In addition to the abstracted classes, 
this package contains enumeration of 
supported OS families and their components.
Figure 2 shows these enumeration classes.

  <b>Figure 2</b>: Supported Families and Components
[http://staff.aist.go.jp/nakamura-akihito/six/oval/six-oval-1_0/oval.model_component.png]
